text: Michael H. Hall (August 24, 1890 - 1957) was a railroad engineer and politician. Born in De Soto, Missouri, Hall went to high school in Mayville, New York. He started to work for Great Northern Railway as a locomotive engineer in Everett, Washington and was involved with the railroad labor union. Hall transferred to Superior, Wisconsin and continued to work for the railroad. He served in the Wisconsin State Assembly in 1935 and 1937 and was elected on the Wisconsin Progressive Party ticket.'Wisconsin Blue Book 1937,' Biographical Sketch of Michael H. Hall, pg. 43 ==Notes== Category:1890 births Category:1957 deaths Category:People from De Soto, Missouri Category:People from Mayville, New York Category:Politicians from Superior, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Progressives (1924) Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:American locomotive engineers Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Michael H. Hall
